unsigned int getLocalDelay ( EtherFrame *  frame  ) 

Returns the delay of a frame for the current node.

The local delay is the time a frame was delayed in this node. It should be only invoked after the sent_total parameter was set.

Parameters:
frame the EtherFrame for which the delay should be calculated
Returns:
the delay in ticks (can be translated to real-time using the tick parameter of the scheduler of the current node). Returns 0 if parameters are not present

unsigned int getTotalDelay ( EtherFrame *  frame  ) 

Returns the total delay of a frame.

The total delay is the time a frame was delayed in hosts and switches. It does not include the transmission. The function relies on the sent_total and received_total parameters.

Parameters:
frame the EtherFrame for which the delay should be calculated
Returns:
the delay in ticks (should not be translated to real-time as it relies on the clock speed of different nodes). Returns 0 if parameters are not present

Definition at line 57 of file HelperFunctions.cc.
